intro: Otosema extensa, commonly known as the broad-leaved flax. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, temperate climates. The plant has a taproot system and produces small, oval-shaped fruits. It is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators.
